fields.description:
h2. Update:
h3. Hey everyone, a bit of an update on this ticket - this gadget was intended to work for JSD only, and the best way we chose going forward to prevent non-JSD instances from running into an gadget that can't work for them, is to prevent that gadget from being visible from non-JSD instances. Supporting it for non-JSD instances is something we've looked into and is far more complex to make happen. Please go to this [suggestion ticket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67612] and vote on it if you'd like to see this happen.

 
h2. *History of this ticket:*
h3. Summary:

The gadget *Filter Count* is returning an error: *Unknown error occurred initializing this gadget.* 

This behavior occurs when the instance doesn't have Service Desk Application.

The filter can return issues of software and business projects based on filter queries and there is no documentation that this gadget is restricted to JIRA Service Desk Application.
h3. Environment: 
h6. JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 * Using an instance with only JIRA Software/JIRA Core applications, navigate to a dashboard
 * Try to add the gadget *Filter Counts*

h3. Expected results:

The gadget is displayed.
h3. Actual Results:

The error is returned: *Unknown error occurred initializing this gadget.*
h3. Workaround:

Install JIRA Service Desk Application.
fields.summary: Filter Count Gadget only works if the instance have Service Desk Application

 !releases.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JIRA interface to manage workflows is complicated to use and time demanding. For example, if the user wants to clean up all the items or the inactive workflows, 
they are in the section Inactive, that comes closed. Then you open it and delete one item. The page then reloads and it comes again with the Inactive section closed. If the user wants to remove 10 workflows schemes, It need to do all these steps 10 times. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Display a checkbox that allow the users to to select multiple schemes and delete all at once.
fields.summary: Enhance interface to manage workflows and other administrative items

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There are cases where base64 code is needed to be sent as a URL argument on the JIRA webhook so that JIRA can authentic to the recipient webhook server. Special characters on these URL arguments are not sent out properly from JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a webhook in JIRA
- Specify a URL argument containing special characters. (i.e. {{code=asdasohdoasdoasd==}})
- Trigger the event

h3. Expected Results

Special characters should be sent as part of the URL arguments.

h3. Actual Results

|Format|Webhook|URL Received|
|Plain Text|https://www.webhhook_server.com/endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd==&test=test|POST /endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd&test=test&user_id=admin&user_key=admin|
|URL Encoded|https://www.webhhook_server.com/endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd%3D%3D|POST /endpoint?code=asdasohdoasdoasd%253D%253D&user_id=admin&user_key=admin|

h3. Notes

(!) This can happen more frequently with endpoints generated on Azure. Usually, the generated endpoint will end with double equal signs, which are removed when the webhook is fired by JIRA. 

h3. Workaround

* This workaround already worked for a few customers affected by the BUG, it consists in trying to generate another *authorization key* in the Azure side making sure that it doesn't contain any special characters.
fields.summary: Webhook calls fail if destination URL contains special characters

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 3rd Jan 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0|titleColor=#FFFFFF}

An first version of the fix for this issue was released on the 15th of December. However, this has been reverted back due to some undesired side-effects. 

We are currently investigating what caused the side-effects. A second version of the fix will be released asap.
_____
{panel}

h3. Summary

Mail handlers are creating duplicated tickets. It seems like what happens is:

 
 * The mail handler starts processing a big message, (a big one or one with attachments for example).
 * The mail handler takes longer than the configured delay to finish processing this message. The default delay is 1 minute.
 * When the configured delay finishes, the mail handler accesses the mail box and starts processing the same message again.
 * It happens because JIRA didn’t finish processing the message in the first time and due to this the message was not deleted yet.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email with attachments to a mail handler with the default timeout (1 min)

h3. Expected Results

The mail handler should process this email and create 1 issue with it
h3. Actual Results

The connection to the mail server closes before the handler is done processing the email. Therefore that email is not removed from the mail server and at the next run the handler will process the same email again, creating duplicated issues.

The below lines are found in the logs:
{noformat}
ERROR   com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice  MAIL_HANDLER_NAME: The connection is no longer open, messages marked as deleted will not be purged from the remote server: imap.gmail.com until the next run.           

2017-09-27 22:48:36.967 ERROR   com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice  MAIL_HANDLER_NAME: The folder has been closed on us, stop processing any more emails: * BYE JavaMail Exception: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out        * BYE JavaMail Exception: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out       javax.mail.FolderClosedException: * BYE JavaMail Exception: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.loadFlags(IMAPMessage.java:1557)
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.isSet(IMAPMessage.java:1021) 
......
{noformat}
h3. Notes

This issue has multiple root-causes and it is not necessarily caused by emails bigger than 10MB. It is enough that the email handler is not done processing the incoming emails within the configured time interval.

Currently we fixed the timeout that was closing the connection before the handler is done processing so now this issue should occur less often. Once we will also fix the other cause (emails too big) then we will mark this bug a resolved. 
h3. Workaround

* Increase the delay configuration in the mail handler, OR
* Remove the mails to archive or move them to a different folder/mailbox from the one that JIRA is trying to scan through. (more information in [Logs Contain 'Exception: null javax.mail.FolderClosedException' when JIRA using IMAP mail server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/logs-contain-exception-null-javax-mail-folderclosedexception-when-jira-using-imap-mail-server-385319403.html])
fields.summary: Mail Handler creating duplicated tickets

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When editing text for a JIRA Issue within the SCRUM board, the attachment list is empty even if there are existing attachments on the JIRA Issue. The issue can be replicated on the following :

- New Comment
- Edit Comment
- Edit Description

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Click on one JIRA Issue in the backlog
- Drag and drop an attachment to the JIRA Issue
- Add a new comment / Edit an existing comment / Edit the description
- Click on the Attachment drop down

h3. Expected Results

- The existing attachments should be listed for referencing in the text.

h3. Actual Results

- The attachment drop down list is empty.

 !edit description.png|thumbnail!  !edit comment.png|thumbnail!  !new comment.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

- Right Click on the Issue Key > Open in a new tab 
- Edit the text in this tab and the attachments should be listed fine.
fields.summary: Attachments list empty when editing text within the Scrum board

fields.description:
h3. Actual Behaviour

There is no longer a date stamp in the file name and an approximate indication of backup file size. As a result, customer wouldn't know when the backup is created and how big the size of the backup.

 

Example scenario: Users hesitate to click the "Download backup file" link because they aren't sure when the backup was created. It might have been done by someone else
h3. *Request Behaviour.*

*Provide date stamp in the file name of the backup file and an approximate indication of backup file size*
fields.summary: Provide date stamp in the file name of the backup file and an approximate indication of backup file size

fields.description:
h3. Actual Behaviour

At the moment, user is not able to validate the MD5 checksum of the backup file. As a result, users will have a problem confirming the integrity of downloaded backup files. 
h3. *Requested Behaviour*

*The desired behaviour is to have a feature where user/administrator can validate the MD5 checksum of the backup file.*
fields.summary: Allow users to validate the MD5 checksum of their backup file

fields.description:
HipChat now supports the Card type messsages and an alternate text message can be also passed to the server, so if the Jabber client does not support HTML, it will display the text instead.

However it seems the JIRA integration sends direct HTML code (not even Card, but looks like a card), which looks horrible when using a non GUI based Jabber client like irssi.

 

Not quite sure if this is the right project, feel free to transfer it to the proper location.
fields.summary: JIRA HipChat should send Card type messages instead of explicit HTML

fields.description:
I'd like to build a filter to find all stories whose story points have changed within a certain period.  

Either from nothing to something, or from one value to another.

We often will put in stories that we use as 'placeholders', at the step where you create an epic perhaps, and have 3 or 4 high level stories reflecting the work, that get roughly sized.  After the work is researched and we have a plan for how to address it, we further break down the stories, size those, and re-size the originals.  I'd like to be able to query these so the PO can assess the recent changes for priority or removal from release.

To my knowledge, I cannot do this from the Cloud, even with a plugin or addon?

I believe Emily wants the same thing.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/JIRA-questions/How-do-I-query-Story-Point-updates-in-JIRA/qaq-p/627204
fields.summary: Provide ability to query changes to story points

fields.description:
We have a requirement to track scope changes in a release. 

Currently "Version Report" shows only Completed & Incomplete Issues.

Suggestion is to enhance the "Version Report" to include 'Added Issues' & 'Removed Issues' subsection. Only Issues added to Release (Version) after the Release 'Start Date' need to be included in 'Added Issues' section.

This will help us in determining the scope changes for the release.
fields.summary: Enhance Version Report to show issues added / removed from Version(Release)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When connecting a JIRA instance with a Slack channel using the {{/jira connect}} command, jirabot isn't added to the channel. This is causing issues with the issue preview feature. Providing the issue's URL or Key doesn't work, only using the {{/jira issueKey}} will pull the issue's information from the JIRA project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a link between a JIRA project and a Slack channel by using the {{/jira connect}} command
# Provide an issue's key or issue's URL on the Slack channel
 
h3. Expected Results
The integration should pull the issue's information and display them on the Slack channel

h3. Actual Results
Issue's information will not be displayed. 

h3.Workaround
The current workaround is to invite the jirabot explicitly by using the {{/invite jirabot}} command. After doing this, mentioning an issue's key or URL will pull the issue's information correctly.
fields.summary: Issue previews (unfurling) feature doesn't work if jirabot isn't invited by using /invite command on the Slack channel

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A project may be created without any Standard Issue Types, causing all sorts of severe symptoms:
# Creating tickets in the project fail 
# When we see the 'create screen' when trying to create an issue, it shows several Issue Types repeatedly under ID numbers (very strange behavior)
# Also, if we click the 'Create' button on the top, it fails to open a pop-up window (we can only open in another tab), so we can't even choose the project in this case

Whenever we create a project, JIRA uses a specific set of Issue Types and creates a new Issue Type scheme by default with those (provided we don't create project with shared configuration). To select the Issue Types to add to the new Issue Type Scheme, it actually uses their names, depending on the system language.

For example, in English, any Business project will be created with the issue types that in the system have the names 'Task' and 'Sub-Task', even if those are not the original ones. 

In that example, if we delete the 'Task' Issue Type and create a new Issue Type in category 'Sub-task', but with name 'Task', it will be used for any new Business project. Since the 'Sub-Task' Issue Type is also a 'Sub-Task type', the projects will be created with 2 Sub-Task types and no Standard Type, causing all the symptoms mentioned above.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Business project, to make sure you have Issue Types with names Task and a Sub-Task (or equivalent names, depending on system language)
# Delete the 'Task' Issue type
# Create a new Issue Type, with name 'Task' again, but using the Sub-Task category
# Create a new Business Project

h3. Expected Results
Some Standard Issue Type is added to the second project and it works.

h3. Actual Results
Second project created doesn't have a Standard Issue Type and it doesn't work.


h3.Workaround
h4. Fixing existing project
Add a Standard Issue Type to the 'broken' projects

h4. Prevent future problems
Rename the 'Task' issue type to something else. The next Business project created will re-create the 'Task' Issue Type using the Standard category.
fields.summary: After project creation its Issue Type Scheme may not have standard Issue Types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As per *Text Formatting Notation help*, Confluence pages can be linked using a text notation but the notation does not work.

{quote}
https://cloud_instance.atlassian.net/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=links

|[pagetitle] or [spacekey:pagetitle]	| Creates a link to the specified page in the desired space (or the confluence space associated with this JIRA project if you dont specify any space).|
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a new Confluence space (Software Project Space) and link to an existing JIRA Project
- Go to the project in JIRA and edit an Issue
- Edit the Description
- Use the Confluence link notation and save the changes

h3. Expected Results

The notation should turn into a link to the Confluence page.

h3. Actual Results

The notation does not render as a link.

 !notation.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Use the external link notation. [<Page Name>:<Full URL of the Confluence page>]
fields.summary: Cannot link Confluence page using text notation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Running a search calling the REST API endpoint *rest/api/2/search* (methods GET and POST) returns "{{Internal Server Error"}} (error 500) when expanding the *changelog*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a search using the REST API and expand the *changelog*. For example:
{noformat}
curl -D- -u EMAIL:PASSWORD -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{"jql":"key=ISSUE-KEY", "expand": ["changelog"] }' https://INSTANCE/rest/api/2/search
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The issue having "key=ISSUE-KEY" is returned.
h3. Actual Results

{{"HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error"}} is returned and the below exception is logged by JIRA:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor	Returning internal server error in response	 	java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1407.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$TypeOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:222)
at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:96)
at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:53)
[....]

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Too many entities. Was: 1050, limit: 1000
at com.atlassian.jira.entity.property.JsonEntityPropertyManagerImpl.getPropertiesInternal(JsonEntityPropertyManagerImpl.java:207)
at com.atlassian.jira.entity.property.JsonEntityPropertyManagerImpl.get(JsonEntityPropertyManagerImpl.java:201)
at com.atlassian.jira.entity.property.BaseEntityPropertyService.getPropertiesWithoutPermissionCheck(BaseEntityPropertyService.java:166)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.metadata.DefaultHistoryMetadataManager.getHistoryMetadata(DefaultHistoryMetadataManager.java:67)
a...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Expanding any other property works fine:
{noformat}
curl -D- -u EMAIL:PASSWORD -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -X POST -d '{"jql":"key=ISSUE-KEY", "expand": ["operations", "renderedFields", "versionedRepresentations", "editmeta"] }' https://INSTANCE/rest/api/2/search
.....
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
......

{"expand":"names,schema","startAt":0,"maxResults":50,"total":1,"issues":[{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"22519","self":....
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

We have recently added a new API endpoint to retrieve all the *changelog* entries for an issue:
- [rest/api/2/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/changelog|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue/%7BissueIdOrKey%7D/changelog]

Please see the [JIRA Cloud REST API Reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue/%7BissueIdOrKey%7D/changelog] for details.
fields.summary: rest/api/2/search endpoint returns error 500 when expanding the changelog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 - Backlog quick filters that utilize an ORDER BY query not based on Rank aren't functioning if a Rank has been set for an issue

h3. Suggested Solution
 - Allow for the capability of a rank reset when a quick filter is triggered

h3. Why this is important
 - In a lot of cases, the "Priority Order" quick filter is rendered useless if a physical rank has been placed for some issues
fields.summary: Backlog quick filters should have the ability to supersede default filter

fields.description:
If you're going to make your login screens consistent, why don't you put both username and password on them, WITHOUT anything between them so a normal user can type a username, TAB, password.

Going to the Jira login page, there's a message at the top of the page suggesting how consistency between products.
On the Jira, the login page is an Email, followed by a link to Privacy Policy, followed by a Next button, that inserts a password field between the email and privacy policy links. Very non-linear, and confusing to a keyboard user.
Then going to your bitbucket login page we have email, followed by the password, followed by Login.
So my suggestion is to fix your Jira login page to follow industry norms like your bitbucket login page.
fields.summary: Make JIRA login screens simple and consistent using only username and password

fields.description:
Currently there is only one way to get remote links from issues.
 REST endpoint:
 [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-getRemoteIssueLinks]
 Why not search result includes this kind of info(remotelinks), as issue links, for example?
 This will be helpful for add-on developers and great for JIRA instances(many requests decrease JIRA's performance) once the number of requests will decrease.
 [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/search|http://example.com/]
fields.summary: Provide remotelinks info on /rest/api/2/search REST endpoint.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for a user in People configuration page can be slow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Go to project settings
- Click *Add People*
- Search for a user (username or email address)

h3. Expected Results

Results should be returned within an acceptable time.

h3. Actual Results

Search result may take 10 seconds or more to be retrieved.
fields.summary: Searching for a user in People can be slow

fields.description:
I am in a team of two that manages hundreds of filters, yet any given filter can only be managed by one of us. This is phenomenally inefficient. We need all designated users to be able to manage these filters; that means both of us, plus designated frontline users of each filter.

Ideally both multiple users AND groups could be assigned as owners of a filter. If we had to choose between multiple users OR groups we would prefer multiple users as that allows us to achieve instant granularity on a case-by-case basis without have to create a group each time. 

Please give this request serious consideration. It is essential to allow efficient management of JIRA at scale.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow filters to be edited by multiple users or by a group

fields.description:
Having the ability to specify conditions and validators which trigger when the transitioning issue matches a JQL statement would be extremely powerful.  

For example when transitioning issue "PROJ-1", my validator would run a JQL search on

{{(key = PROJ-1) AND (my custom JQL statement)}}

and the transition would succeed if and only if the search returned results.

 

Most of my team's multi-field business logic can be expressed in JQL statements.  I know this because I currently have a dashboard of JQL filter widgets which list issues which are in an invalid state.  I'd love it if tickets couldn't get into the invalid state in the first place.
fields.summary: Add "matches JQL" workflow conditions and validators

fields.description:
It would be nice to have an automated email response if an issue is created in JIRA Service Desk with StatusPage addon, stating that there is an issue and to check the StatusPage.

The feature request is that a lot of users utilize email to create issues and do not view the portal.  If they do not view the portal, they will be unaware of the StatusPage incident page.
fields.summary: Auto respond via email if StatusPage incidents are open in JIRA Service Desk add-on

fields.description:
h3. Problem
According to the JIRA documentation of REST API, we have an experimental call to delete users:
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/user-removeUser

Although, we don't have any calls to deactivate the user, which is necessary and a different action.

h3. Suggestion
Create a REST API call which deactivates users

h3. Workaround
Deactivate directly from the UI on Confluence.
fields.summary: Create REST API call to deactivate users

fields.description: I find that when cleaning up filters, I get good feedback if they are used by a board, but not if they are used by a  dashboard. It would be helpful to be made aware of all references when I go to delete the filter.
fields.summary: Flag referenced to Filter on deletion

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

This feature request stems from JRACLOUD-43539.

Because of [the current product design of JIRA|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43539?focusedCommentId=1401709&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1401709], the same issue types or resolutions could be created as different things depending on the system language when creating new project.

For example, issue type "Bug" and "バグ" (it means "Bug" in Japanese) are created in the following scenario.

# Set the system language to English
# Create a Scrum software development project
# Issue type "Bug" is created if it doesn't exist
# Change the system language to Japanese
# Create another Scrum software development project
# Issue type "バグ" is created even though "Bug" exists

After that, both of the issue types are shown as "バグ" due to [the translation feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/translating-resolutions-priorities-statuses-and-issue-types-788726079.html] in case user language or system language is set to Japanese. (FYI. "バグ" is the default translation for "Bug".)

Please see the following screenshots which were taken when I associated issue types to screen scheme.

* English
 !issuetype_english.png|thumbnail! 
* Japanese
 !issuetype_japanese.png|thumbnail! 

Then, users cannot recognize which issue type they should use unless they change their language setting back to English.

It might be an expected behavior but it would be stressful for non English customers who didn't know the product design. At worst, they don't even notice what's going on in the screen which they're look at.

h3. Suggested Solution

In my opinion, there are several type of solutions. The followings are just for the examples. Any better solution is welcome!

# Provide a way to recognize translated issue types and original issue types
# Alert users when new issue type is created in case that the issue type name has already been taken for translation of other issue type
fields.summary: Need way to recognize translated issue types and resolutions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Average Age Chart doesn't show project/filter name when it's added in the dashboard. As shown in [Adding Averaga gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-average-age-gadget-720417014.html], it should display the project/filter selected for this gadget.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Select any project/filter
# Save

h3. Actual Result

It doesn't show the project/filter name
-  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Result

It should show the project/filter name next to gadget title
fields.summary: Average Age Chart doesn't show project/filter name

fields.description:
Large number of filters on issue navigator causes pagination errors in Firefox
h3. Summary

When a large number of filters are saved as favorites in the issue navigator panel, pagination errors occur in Firefox.
h3. Environment

Cloud - Firefox
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create and add a large number of saved filters (20+)
 # Navigate to the issue navigator
 # Firefox window auto tries to scroll to the bottom, does not let customer scroll back up.

h3. Expected Results

Full window to be displayed of JIRA, staying at the top without auto scrolling.
h3. Actual Results

Firefox seems to auto scroll to the bottom of the page, user cannot scroll back up to the top (JIRA Header).

[https://screencast.com/t/M5cxmc9v]

Resizing the window brings back the page:

[https://screencast.com/t/pHAUQ62OW8ST]
h3. Workaround
 * Use another Browser
 * Resize Window.
fields.summary: Large number of filters on issue navigator causes pagination errors in Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Date Compare Validator is not working with *{{now}}* parameter

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom *Date Picker* field and configure in a project. (Please note, the *Date Picker*, not the *Date Time Picker*)
# On the project workflow, create a Date Compare Validator with a condition *{{>}}* or *{{>=}}* and compare with expression *{{now}}*
# In the following scenario, the validator was configured on the issue creation.
!Validator settings.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The validator would check it the date is equal or greater than *now*, and if the criteria are met, the issue is successfully created, otherwise it will prevent the issue creation showing an error message.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is not created because it says the date does not match. For example, setting the date as *29/Aug* (Today), you got the following error message:
{code}Custom Date Field isn't greater than or equal to (29/Aug/17 4:56 PM){code}
!Error message.png|thumbnail!
The error is always throwing as if you were 3 hours behind of your current timezone. 

h3. Notes
The validator should ignore the hour as it's mentioned in the description:
!Validator Description.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Date Compare Validator is not working when using the NOW parameter

fields.description:
h2. Problem Statement
At the moment, if the attachments attached to the email exceed the default JIRA attachment size limit, the email will not be picked up and created as a ticket in JIRA. The users will have no clue whether the email has been processed or not.

h2. Suggested Solution
It would be great if JIRA could:
* pick up and create a ticket for the email AND 
* if the attachment size exceeds the limit, drop the attachment alone and add an error message about the attachment in the newly created ticket
fields.summary: Allow email to be processed as JIRA issue even though the attachment exceeds the size limit

fields.description:
h3.Summary

DVCS automatic access is not sending Bitbucket invites to users.

h3.Steps to Replicate

# Setup automatic access for Bitbucket as per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/configure-automatic-team-invitations-329982195.html].
# Invite a new user to the instance. 

h3.Investigation Done

Some tests are performed.

# Add my own dummy email address (not registered in Bitbucket Cloud) from Bitbucket Cloud = Receive invitation
# Add my 2nd dummy email address (that is registered in Bitbucket Cloud) from Bitbucket Cloud = No invitation; but a notification email is sent.
# Add a new user from JIRA with the automatic access configuration enabled = Nothing is sent (based on Sendgrid).

So the problem here is not on Bitbucket Cloud but on JIRA Cloud since Cloud is not triggering Sendgrid to send any invitations emails.

h3.Expected Result

Newly invited user should get invitation to JIRA and Bitbucket. Invitation email should be something like the one below.

!invitation email.PNG|thumbnail!

h3.Current Result

Newly invited user only get invitation to JIRA.


h3.Workaround

Invite the user manually into the access group from Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: DVCS Automatic Access not sending out invitation

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms
 * A custom field called "myCustomField" is created, and is assigned globally to all projects/issue types
 * Some issues have a value for this field, some do not
 * Searching for {{myCustomField IS EMPTY}} using JQL returns no results, despite there being known issues with an empty value for that custom field

h3. Work around
You can either open a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] in order to have this issue fixed, or you can use the below workaround:
# Save the below search as a filter named e.g. "SAVED FILTER" (replace CUSTOM_FIELD with the actual custom field name): {noformat}
CUSTOM_FIELD is not EMPTY 
{noformat}
# Run the below search and see that this works: {noformat}
NOT filter = "SAVED FILTER"
{noformat}

For details see:
 - [JQL query Custom field is empty search not working...|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Core-questions/JQL-query-Custom-field-is-empty-search-not-working-with-contexts/qaq-p/148794]
fields.summary: JQL search for custom field IS EMPTY is not returning any results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When Project Administrator without Global Administrator permissions edits available configuration options under Project Settings >> Details any preconfigured Project category is deleted
h3. Environment

JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Log in as user with Project admin and without Global Admin
 * Navigate to a project that has a Project category configured by global admin
 * Desired Project >> Project Settings >> Details
 * Edit any of the available fields and save (Name, URL, Avatar, Description, Lead)
 * OR Without editing any options just select save details

h3. Expected Results

Project Category is not changed as the user does not have permission to alter this field
h3. Actual Results

Project Category is set to NONE
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
h3. Notes

According to [Editing project details|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-a-project-s-details-938021482.html], it is mentioned that as project admin (it doesn't mentioned with/without _JIRA Administrator_ from Global Permission) should have permission to edit the following:
 # Name
 # Key
 # URL
 # Project type
 # Project category
 # Avatar
 # Description
 # Project lead
 # Default assignee
fields.summary: Editing Project Details Removes Project Category

fields.description:

"You have entered new data on this page. If you navigate away from this page without first saving your data, your changes will be lost"
{code}

h3. Actual Results

No message is displayed and the changes get lost.
fields.summary: When editing an issue in the board, if I preview the description with the changes and press esc, the changes get lost

Setting up a transition condition with the Epic Link field does not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic issue e.g: Epic 1
# Create a Sory and associate it to the Epic
# Edit your project workflow adding a new status
# Edit the transition to this status adding a condition of Value of field
# Set the condition like the following:
 !cond.png|thumbnail!
# Check if the new status appears to issues under the Epic 1

h3. Expected Results

The status should only appear to issues under Epic 1.

h3. Actual Results
The condition doesn't work at all and the status does not appear to issues under the Epic 1.

fields.description:
As a JIRA Admin I would like to have an ability in Permission schemes to deny a permission from a user or a group.

Currently there is no easy way to do it. I have a project that requires a special permission scheme that gives all JIRA Users group browse permission except for one specific user.

The user should be able to work as usual like any other JIRA user in all other project, except that confidential project that is allowed for everybody except him.
fields.summary: Add ability in Permission schemes to deny a permission from a user or a group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html] documentation, a wildcard ( * )  can be used for text searches. When the result strings are hyphenated, the wildcard does not work properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create some issues with the following *SUMMARY* details
- AA-BBBBB-FFF
- AA-BBBBB-DDD
- AA-BBBBB-CCC
- AA-BBBBB-CCC-200_ZY-2019


Use the wildcard on text searches :
|Search JQL| Expected Results| Actual Results|
|summary ~ "AA*"| Returns All |Returns All|
|summary ~ "AA-*"| Returns All |No results|
|Summary ~ "AA-BBBBB*"| Returns All |No results|
|Summary ~ "AA-BBBBB-*"| Returns All |No results|
fields.summary: Contains wildcard does not work for hyphenated strings

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [SLA (Service Level Agreement)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-slas-732528967.html] is available in Service Desk Projects. 
{quote}
JIRA Service Desk provides powerful built-in Service Level Agreement (or SLA) management so you can track your team's progress against agreements you've set for customers. An SLA is made up of two settings:
* A time metric, which lets you define how time will be measured for this SLA; and,
* A goal for selected issues, which lets you define a target for the time metric. Different sets of issues can have different goals.
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Make SLA's visible in Software projects for JSW ticket related to a JSD ticket

h3. Why this is important
Customer's comment:
{quote}
3. One of the important part is SLA tracking but in JSW
there is no SLA tracking. From customer's point of view, it hardly matters if
support is working on it or development. All they want is a solution in the
promised SLA. But if dev team does not have a view on SLA, then how will they
provide the solution in time. Hence in JSW as well, there should be a way to do
the SLA monitoring. SLA values should come from JSD only. So it is a kind of
view available in JSW from JSD, so that both support and dev can work as one
team to provide support to the customer with a common SLA.
{quote}
fields.summary: Make SLA's visible in Software projects for JSW ticket related to a JSD ticket

fields.description:
When a project has enabled sub-tasks the detailed view  of an issue in the board view shows a sub-task tab with a "Create Sub-Task" button.

However, no other of the detailed view has this tab or options to directly. Instead this action to create a sub-task is available in the "..." menu.

fields.description:
In the backlog view there is a context menu (right-click) enabled in the issue list to allow issue action such as splitting an issue.

However, in the other issue list view, like "Issues" there is no such menu enabled at all. There is no reason not to have the same actions available in all lists.

In fact the only way I have found to split an issue is to go into the backlog list and use that context menu. For this specific actions there is no reason not to have the "Split issue" available in the other menus that include issue actions.

These inconsistencies makes the learning curve for new users even higher.
fields.summary: Inconsistent and confusing use of context menu

fields.description:

None.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In some instances, operator {{= Empty}} is broken when combining with other condition, for example: JQL {{resolutiondate = EMPTY OR resolutiondate >= -30d}} is returning incorrect results. The results will be less than JQL {{resolutiondate = EMPTY}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Type the following JQL: {{resolutiondate = empty}}
Please take note the number of records returned.
# Next, combine the JQL above with other condition, for example: {{resolutiondate = empty OR resolutiondate >= "-30d"}}
Please take note the number of records returned. 

h3. Expected Results
The results will be the {{OR}} of both conditions

h3. Actual Results
The number of records that is returned is actually less than the JQL {{resolutiondate = empty}} alone. In this case: {{resolutiondate = empty OR resolutiondate >= "-30d"}} returns less number of records than {{resolutiondate = empty}}

h3. Workaround
Modify {{= empty}} to use {{is empty}} instead

h3. Additional Notes
{{resolutiondate = EMPTY}} works!
{{resolutiondate is EMPTY}} works!
{{resolutiondate is EMPTY OR resolutiondate >= -30d}} works!
{{resolutiondate = EMPTY OR resolutiondate >= -30d}} returns incorrect results!
fields.summary: JQL equals to Empty is returning incorrect results when combining with other conditions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Equal Operator ("=") in the Issue navigator doesn't finds results for dates (Updated, Resolved..)
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Issue Navigator
 # Search for issues with updated date for example
 # Check the date when a specific issue was updated
 ** !Updated equal.png|thumbnail!
 # Query for issues which were updated on this specific date
 ** !Updated equal 1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Issue is found
h3. Actual Results

Issue is not found in the results
 * !Equal operator.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Use a timestamp in the date value specified to ensure the full day is included. e.g.

{{resolved <= "2017-08-28 23:59"}} instead of {{resolved <= "2017-08-28"}}

Alternatively, you can use the {{endOfDay()}} function. The function takes an input which is a relative date specifier, so it may not be as useful.
fields.summary: Equal Operator in the Issue navigator doesn't finds results for dates

fields.description:
If you have a user that does not have application access to JIRA or Confluence (or both), when they browse to the application on the instance they see a "Log in" button. When they click the button, they are simply redirected back to the same page without the option to change who they are logged in as.

I believe this is because the user is already logged into id.atlassian.net and they already have a token so they are instantly redirected back to the page from whence they came.

Would it be possible to detect being logged into Atlassian Account and make the button behave more intuitively?
fields.summary: Users without application access see a "log in" button but do not get the chance to change credentials.

fields.description: Logging in to JIRA without JIRA application access results in a redirect to the dashboard with no error messages. It also still displays the "login" link at the top right despite already entering your credentials and authenticating.
fields.summary: LogIn should only show when the user is not authenticated; not when the user simply lacks USE permission.
As a JIRA administrator, I want a specific set of permissions to see/manage project releases

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 DEC 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi All,

This is a duplicate of [JRACLOUD-67890 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67890]. Please follow along on JRACLOUD-67890 for future updates on this issue.

Regards,
Atlassian

{panel}


h3. Summary

In new menu *People* available on the project settings of some instances, it is not possible to remove a group of a role if the group was already deleted on user management. Reproducible on JIRA v1000.1210.0
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click in Cog Icon > User Management
 # On the left panel, click on "Groups"
 # Click to Create a new group (e.g. HR-Admin)
 # navigate to a Project > Project Settings > People
 # Add the Group to any role
 # Navigate back to User *Management > Groups* and delete the group *HR_Admin*
 # Wait for 10 minutes
 # Navigate back to *Project > Project Settings > People* and try to remove the group from the role you added before

P.S: This same problem happens with deleted *Project Roles*.
h3.  
h3. Expected Results

The group should be removed from the Role
h3. Actual Results

It is returned the error below and the role is not removed:

Group 'HR-Admin' was not found in the system.
h3. Workaround

Recreate the group and remove the group from the role. then, delete the group again.
fields.summary: Can not remove deleted groups/Project Roles from role on people session of a project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Chile recently switched their timezone offset from GMT-4 to GMT-3. JIRA will need to have the timezone updated to use the new offset.
{quote}Continental Chile,will use time zone UTC – 3, starting at 24:00 hours, local time, with exception of the Region of Magallanes and the Antarctic Territory.
{quote}
[http://www.horaoficial.cl/cambio/index_ing.html]
{quote}Continental Chile: UTC-3 in summer time and UTC-4 in winter time.
 The winter time stars the second Saturday of May and ends on the second Saturday of August.
{quote}
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_in_Chile]
h3. Environment
 * Effects Cloud - JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set JIRA User profile to use Santiago time zone

h3. Expected Results
 * Timezone off-set should be GMT-03:00

h3. Actual Results
 * Timezone off-set is set to GMT-04:00

h3. Workaround

Select another timezone that's currently in GMT-03:00
fields.summary: Update time zone for Santiago, Chile

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When searching the field of an issue that was transitioned and edited through a *POST* REST API request, it will return nothing.

If you search the field of an issue that was edited through the *UI* OR a *PUT* REST API request, the search will show that issue.

See the examples below.

When runnig the POST REST API request
{code}curl -D- -u USERHERE -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"update": {"comment": [{"add":{ "body": "test" }} ] },"transition":{ "id":"21" },"fields":{"customfield_10046":"4.4.4.4","resolution":{"name":"Done"}} }' https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/BS-8/transitions{code}

Then, searching with the JQL query
{code}project = BS and "Root Cause Analysis" ~ "4.4.4.4"{code}

It *won't show any results*.

However, if you use a PUT request OR edit the issue through the UI, the search will show the issue.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1001.0.0-SNAPSHOT

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a POST request to transition an issue and update a field
# search for the field using "~" and the value you used in the API request

h3. Expected Results
* It should show the issue when searching for it.

h3. Workaround
# Edit the issue through the UI
# Edit the issue through PUT request
# Edit the issue through PUT request then transition with POST
fields.summary: Issue isn't searchable by the field updated via API POST to the transitions endpoint

Button is greyed out.

fields.description:
Hi,

We need to make sure that usernames for our JIRA users are their emails. This is because our customers can move from one company to another, so [joe.smith@company1.com|mailto:joe.smith@company1.com] can move to company 2, and I need to differentiate between his accounts in the old and new companies. 

Thankfully you (still) allow to edit their username after user creation, but it's inconvenient. Best would be to just have an option: "use full email for username".

 

Another problem is that I can not edit their full name. It either becomes "Joe.Smith" (with a dot, which is wrong), or if an email is jsmith@company2.com, then the whole thing becomes the full name. 

I know that the user can change their full name on their own, but it would be nicer if I had a way to set it at creation time, as before.

Thanks, Kirill
fields.summary: User creation changes lead to bad username and full name
Add Typescript language support in code blocks

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In our application, We use to create the user on Jira via rest API. We set the password in the body content. No email verification is required if the password is set via API body content. This issue has already been identified as a bug:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67024\\ 

So email verification is required and the user was able to log in after the email verification (password already set via REST API body content).
But now again Jira changed something and It is mandatory to create the password, after clicking the email verification link. If we set the password file via REST API.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a REST API call to create user, and set password via Body Content:
#* {code}{ 
"name": "testingUser", 
"password": "dummyPassowrd",
"emailAddress": "testingnamre@gmail.com ", 
"displayName": "testingUser" 
}{code}
# User will get the email verification link.

h3. Expected Results
* Can proceed to login without having to set password again

h3. Actual Results
*  After clicking the link, Its mandatory to create password, which is wrong because we already set password via API.

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: It is mandatory to create the password when we set the password file via REST API.
Please support Markdown or backticks in Description

fields.description:
Problem Description

Currently, when generating a backup file in JIRA. *Backup for Cloud* and *Backup for Server* both share a same backup timer. After generating a *Backup for Cloud*, users can't generate a *Backup for Server* in another 48 hours.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Have a separate backup frequency for *Backup for Cloud* and *Backup for Server*. This way, users will be able to generate 2 backups, for Cloud as well as Server.
fields.summary: Have different Backup Frequency for Cloud and Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to create customized sections on the issue screen.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to create customized sections.
fields.summary: Ability to create customized sections on issue screen

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
Creating a Jira Core business/ software Project, issues are unable to load on the Board once viewed. A white blank background is shown with only the assignee field visible. Refreshing the page doesn't work and switching to the old issue view doesn't have any effect on the Jira Core Business Project.

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 - Create a Jira Project - Using the Jira Core Business template or Jira Software Projects
 - Create some issues on the Project
 - Go to the Board and click on the Issue to view it
 - Issue loads on the modal Screen with a white blank background.
{panel}

h3.*Expected Result*
Issues should be able to load on the modal screen.

h3.*Actual Result*
Issue doesn't load and shows a white blank background with only the assignee field visible.
*   !image-3.png|thumbnail!  

h3.*Dev Tools*
To add a Little context, navigate to Business Board, double click on an issue. The Modal frame doesn't load, instead a white background with only the assignee field appears.
this type of error *DOM7011* on the console referring to http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=291337 which refers to a Back Navigation Caching as it causes the issue view screen to crash the browser then refreshes it which makes the issue then viewable. So a hypothesis would be that, this is more towards how issues are rendered on a Modal Screen in *IE11* as opposed to it being caused by a script.

* !screen3.png|thumbnail!   
* !image-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3.*Work Around*
* None at the moment for Jira Core Business Project
* Switch to the Old Issue view for Jira Software Project *Personal Settings > Under Jira Labs* - toggle the action button to "OFF" (/)
(i) Please note switching to Old Issue view is not available for next-gen Projects and Business Projects
fields.summary: Unable to load issue detail frame on IE 11 in Business projects / Software Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Multiple JIRA issues will be broken if a user tries to CSV import an IssueKey that was previously existing in the project and later on moved to another project.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Prepare 2 projects, one with more issues than the other.
- Create an issue on Project A. (ie ProjA-10)
- Move the issue to Project B. (ProjA-10 will be converted to ProjB-5)
- Use the External System Import (CSV). Import an issue re-using the issuekey ProjA-10.


h3. Expected Results

- ProjA-10 will be created as a new issue.
- ProjB-5 should not be affected.


h3. Actual Results

- ProjA-10 will be in broken state (500 error).
- ProjA-5 will be in broken state (500 error).
- ProjB-5 will be missing.
fields.summary: Import failure for an IssueKey that was previously existing and moved to another project

fields.description:
We tested in three different instances, team.

Also, we used different machines and the behavior was the same.

When clicking on an issue in a *Business Project* board, instead of loading the issue detail in a frame, it only shows a few grey bars where the text should be.

Can you verify?

Thank you!
fields.summary: Unable to load issue detail frame on IE 11 in business projects
German Language Translation of JIRA Description is Incorrect

fields.description:
Currently it's not possible to filter items by parent fields. There are a few paid add-ons that do offer this but we only need this feature. We are looking to select all items that have a parent epic that has been linked to a certain team. so ideally the SQL would look something like this:

project = xxx AND Team = 27 OR parentEpic.field["Team"] = 27

We are working on a project with two teams so we have set up a different team boards. From portfolio we are assigning epics to teams. On the team board we want to show all the team epics and all subitems. But now we have to add all the subitems individually to the teams as well.
fields.summary: filter items on parent fields (like Team)

fields.description:
Currently it's not possible to add the portfolio Team field to the issue detail view screen in a scrumboard in JIRA cloud.

We are working with two teams on one project and have made an extra board per team. On out overview board (the full project board) we are dividing the work to the teams. But we can't see to witch team an issue is assigned to without maken a few extra clicks.
fields.summary: Show Team field in board issue detail view

The _Issue Dependencies Viewer_ add-on provides a dashboard gadget called _Dependencies Viewer_. However, this gadget is not available when the add-on is installed in some instances.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to a JIRA dashboard

# Search for _Dependencies Viewer_ gadget

h3. Expected Result
Below gadget will appear in the suggestion:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result
Dependencies Viewer gadget is not in the suggestion list
fields.summary: Issue Dependencies Viewer add-on's gadget is not available in some instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Email Filter Subscriptions are still sent after an user is marked as deactivated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user belonging to jira-users group
 # Deactivate the user
 # Create a filter and subscribed to jira-users group
 ** Filter used: issuekey in issueHistory() ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
 ** Ticked the option to still send an email even there's no issue found.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA would send subscriptions only to active users.
h3. Actual Results

All users belonging to the jira-users group receive the filter subscription email, regardless of being deactivated.
h3. Notes

None
h3. Workaround:
Contact Atlassian Support by opening a support request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com] and ask to have the filter subscriptions for the removed users deleted.
fields.summary: Filter Subscription emails should not be sent to deactivated users.

fields.description:
h3. Current Behavior

It is possible to create a group with special characters on it. Sometimes, it might happen accidentally, while copy/pasting group names from other applications into JIRA.

Having a special character in a group name may eventually break some JIRA functionalities like Group Pickers and etc.

h3. Desired Behavior

Add a validator for no ASCII characters under the User Management Section.
fields.summary: Validate special characters in group names
